00308 //===========================================================================
00309 //
00310 // change size of a population
00311 //
00312 void Population::resize( unsigned n )
00313 {
00314     unsigned i, s = size( );
00315     if( n < s ) {
00316         for( i = n; i < s; ++i )
00317             delete *( begin( ) + i );
00318         vector< Individual * >::erase( begin( ) + n, end( ) );
00319     } else if( n > size( ) ) {
00320         vector< Individual * >::insert( end( ), n - s, ( Individual * )NULL );
00321         if( s > 0 )
00322             for( i = s; i < n; ++i )
00323                 *( begin( ) + i ) = new Individual( *( *( begin( ) ) ) );
00324         else
00325             for( i = s; i < n; ++i )
00326                 *( begin( ) + i ) = new Individual;
00327     }
00328 }

00340 //===========================================================================
00341 
00342 Population& Population::operator = ( const Population& pop )
00343 {
00344     SIZE_CHECK( size( ) == pop.size( ) || ! subPop )
00345 
00346     unsigned i;
00347 
00348     if( size( ) != pop.size( ) ) {
00349         for( i = size( ); i--; )
00350             delete *( begin( ) + i );
00351         vector< Individual * >::operator = ( pop );
00352         for( i = size( ); i--; )
00353             *( begin( ) + i ) = new Individual( pop[ i ] );
00354     } else
00355         for( i = size( ); i--; )
00356             ( *this )[ i ] = pop[ i ];
00357 
00358     return *this;
00359 }

00363 vector< const Chromosome* > Population::matingPool( unsigned chrom,
00364                                                     unsigned from,
00365                                                     unsigned to ) const
00366 {
00367     if( from == 0 && to == 0 )
00368         to = size( ) - 1;
00369 
00370     vector< const Chromosome* > pool;
00371 
00372     for( unsigned i = from; i <= to; ++i )
00373         pool.push_back( &( *this )[ i ][ chrom ] );
00374 
00375     return pool;
00376 }

00380 bool Population::lessFitness( Individual*const& i1, Individual*const& i2 )
00381 {
00382     return i1->fitness < i2->fitness;
00383 }
00384 
00385 bool Population::greaterFitness( Individual*const& i1, Individual*const& i2 )

00389 
00390 void Population::sortIndividuals( vector< Individual * >& indvec )
00391 {
00392     std::sort( indvec.begin( ), indvec.end( ),
00393                ascending ? Population::lessFitness : Population::greaterFitness );
00394 }

00406 {

00408         swap( i, Rng::discrete( 0, size( )-1 ) );

00473 void Population::remove( unsigned i, unsigned k )
00474 {
00475     if( i <= k ) {
00476         RANGE_CHECK( k < size( ) )
00477         for( unsigned j = i; j < k; j++ )
00478             delete *( begin( ) + j );
00479         vector< Individual * >::erase( begin( ) + i, begin( ) + k );
00480     }

00483 //===========================================================================
00484 
00485 void Population::exchange( Population& pop )
00486 {
00487     unsigned buffer1;
00488     bool buffer2;
00489 
00490     SIZE_CHECK( size( ) == pop.size( ) )
00491 
00492     for( unsigned i = size( ); i--; )
00493         std::swap( *( begin( ) + i ), *( pop.begin( ) + i ) );
00494 
00495     // Exchanging internal variables:
00496 
00497     buffer1 = index;
00498     index = pop.index;
00499     pop.index = buffer1;
00500     buffer2 = subPop;
00501     subPop = pop.subPop;
00502     pop.subPop = buffer2;
00503     buffer2 = ascending;
00504     ascending = pop.ascending;
00505     pop.ascending = buffer2;
00506     buffer2 = spinOnce;
00507     spinOnce = pop.spinOnce;
00508     pop.spinOnce = buffer2;
00509 }

00513 Individual& Population::best( Individual& ind0, Individual& ind1 ) const
00514 {
00515     if( (   ascending && ind0.fitness < ind1.fitness ) ||
00516         ( ! ascending && ind0.fitness > ind1.fitness ) ) {
00517         return ind0;
00518     } else {
00519         return ind1;
00520     }
00521 }
00522 
00523 Individual& Population::worst( Individual& ind0, Individual& ind1 ) const
00524 {
00525     if( (   ascending && ind0.fitness < ind1.fitness ) ||
00526         ( ! ascending && ind0.fitness > ind1.fitness ) ) {
00527         return ind1;
00528     } else {
00529         return ind0;
00530     }
00531 }

00533 //===========================================================================
00534 
00535 Individual&
00536 Population::oneOfBest( )
00537 {
00538     RANGE_CHECK( size( ) > 0 )
00539     vector< unsigned > bestIndices;
00540 
00541     // find indices of all best individuals
00542     // assume unsorted population
00543     for( unsigned i = 0; i < size( ); i++ ) {
00544       if (ascending) {
00545           if ( ( *this )[ i ].fitness == maxFitness( ) )
00546               bestIndices.push_back( i );
00547       } else {
00548           if ( ( *this )[ i ].fitness == minFitness( ) )
00549               bestIndices.push_back( i );
00550       }
00551     }
00552 
00553     // return random "best" individual
00554     return( ( *this )[ bestIndices[ Rng::discrete( 0, bestIndices.size( ) - 1 ) ] ] );
00555 }
00556 
00557 const Individual&
00558 Population::oneOfBest( ) const
00559 {
00560     RANGE_CHECK( size( ) > 0 )
00561     vector< unsigned > bestIndices;
00562 
00563     // find indices of all best individuals
00564     // assume unsorted population
00565     for( unsigned i = 0; i < size( ); i++ ) {
00566       if (ascending) {
00567           if ( ( *this )[ i ].fitness == maxFitness( ) )
00568               bestIndices.push_back( i );
00569       } else {
00570           if ( ( *this )[ i ].fitness == minFitness( ) )
00571               bestIndices.push_back( i );
00572       }
00573     }
00574 
00575     // return random "best" individual
00576     return( ( *this )[ bestIndices[ Rng::discrete( 0, bestIndices.size( ) - 1 ) ] ] );
00577 }

00579 //===========================================================================
00580 
00581 unsigned Population::bestIndex( ) const
00582 {
00583     RANGE_CHECK( size( ) > 0 )
00584 
00585     unsigned ind = 0;
00586 
00587     if( ascending ) {
00588         for( unsigned i = 1; i < size( ); i++ )
00589             if( ( *this )[ i ].fitness < ( *this )[ ind ].fitness )
00590                 ind = i;
00591     } else {
00592         for( unsigned i = 1; i < size( ); i++ )
00593             if( ( *this )[ i ].fitness > ( *this )[ ind ].fitness )
00594                 ind = i;
00595     }
00596 
00597     return ind;
00598 }

00600 //===========================================================================
00601 
00602 unsigned Population::worstIndex( ) const
00603 {
00604     RANGE_CHECK( size( ) > 0 )
00605 
00606     unsigned ind = size( )-1;
00607 
00608     if( ascending ) {
00609         for( unsigned i = size( )-1; i--; )
00610             if( ( *this )[ i ].fitness > ( *this )[ ind ].fitness )
00611                 ind = i;
00612     } else {
00613         for( unsigned i = size( )-1; i--; )
00614             if( ( *this )[ i ].fitness < ( *this )[ ind ].fitness )
00615                 ind = i;
00616     }
00617 
00618     return ind;
00619 }

00621 //===========================================================================
00622 
00623 void Population::selectInit( )
00624 {
00625     for( unsigned i = size( ); i--; ) {
00626         ( *this )[ i ].numCopies = 0;
00627         ( *this )[ i ].elitist   = false;
00628     }
00629 }
00630 
00631 void Population::selectElitists( Population& parents,
00632                                  unsigned numElitists )
00633 {
00634     if( numElitists ) {
00635         unsigned   i;
00636         double     s;
00637         Population pop( *this );
00638         vector< Individual * > indvec( pop.size( ) + parents.size( ) );
00639 
00640         //
00641         // sort populations
00642         //
00643         std::copy( pop.begin( ), pop.end( ), indvec.begin( ) );
00644         std::copy( parents.begin( ), parents.end( ), indvec.begin( ) + pop.size( ) );
00645         sortIndividuals( indvec );
00646 
00647         //
00648         // copy elitists and correct selection probabilities
00649         //
00650         for( i = 0; i < size( ) && i < numElitists; i++ ) {
00651             indvec[ i ]->selProb -= min( indvec[i]->selProb, 1./size( ) );
00652             indvec[ i ]->numCopies++;
00653             indvec[ i ]->elitist = true;
00654             ( *this )[ i ] = *indvec[ i ];
00655         }
00656 
00657         s = 0;
00658         for( i = 0; i < parents.size( ); i++ )
00659             s += parents[ i ].selProb;
00660         if( s > 0 )
00661             for( i = 0; i < parents.size( ); i++ )
00662                 parents[ i ].selProb /= s;
00663     }
00664 }
00665 
00666 //===========================================================================
00667 //
00668 // stochastic universal sampling according to Baker,87
00669 //
00670 void Population::selectRouletteWheel( Population& parents,
00671                                       unsigned numElitists )
00672 {
00673     unsigned i, j;
00674     double   p, r, s;
00675 
00676     if( spinOnce ) {
00677         //
00678         // spin the wheel one time, derandomized variant
00679         // (stochastic remainder method according to Baker '87)
00680         //
00681         p = size( ) - numElitists;
00682         r = Rng::uni( 0, 1 );
00683         s = 0.;
00684         for( i = numElitists, j = 0;
00685              i < size( ) && j < parents.size( ); j++ ) {
00686             s += p * parents[ j ].selProb;
00687             while( s > r && i < size( ) ) {
00688                 parents[ j ].numCopies++;
00689                 ( *this )[ i++ ] = parents[ j ];
00690                 r++;
00691             }
00692         }
00693     } else {
00694         //
00695         // full stochastic method
00696         //
00697         for( i = numElitists; i < size( ); ) {
00698             r = Rng::uni( 0, 1 );
00699             s = 0.;
00700             for( j = 0;
00701                  j < parents.size( ) &&
00702                  r >= ( p = parents[ j ].selProb ) + s;
00703                  s += p, j++ );
00704             RANGE_CHECK( j < parents.size( ) )
00705             parents[ j ].numCopies++;
00706             ( *this )[ i++ ] = parents[ j ];
00707         }
00708     }
00709 }
00710 
00711 //===========================================================================
00712 //
00713 // Standard: Die mu besten Individuen aus parents werden in die aktuelle
00714 //           Population uebernommen
00715 // Elitist : Die no_elitists besten Individuen aus parents und der aktuellen
00716 //           Population werden uebernommen und der Rest stammt aus parents,
00717 //           aber keine doppelten aus der Elite.
00718 //
00719 void Population::selectMuLambda( Population& parents,
00720                                  unsigned numElitists )
00721 {
00722     unsigned i, j;
00723 
00724     //
00725     // clear number of copies and select elitists
00726     //
00727     parents.selectInit( );
00728     selectElitists( parents, numElitists );
00729 
00730     //
00731     // sort parents (only pointers)
00732     //
00733     vector< Individual * > indvec( parents );
00734     sortIndividuals( indvec );
00735 
00736     for( i = numElitists, j = 0;
00737          i < size( ) && j < indvec.size( ); j++ ) {
00738         if( ! indvec[ j ]->elitist ) {
00739             indvec[ j ]->numCopies++;
00740             ( *this )[ i++ ] = *indvec[ j ];
00741         }
00742     }
00743 
00744     //
00745     // fill remaining slots with the last/worst individual
00746     //
00747     while( i < size( ) ) {
00748         indvec[ j-1 ]->numCopies++;
00749         ( *this )[ i++ ] = *indvec[ j-1 ];
00750     }
00751 }
00752 
00753 //===========================================================================
00754 //
00755 //
00756 //
00757 void Population::selectMuLambdaKappa( Population& parents,
00758                                       unsigned lifespan,
00759                                       unsigned adolescence )
00760 {
00761     unsigned i, j;
00762     Population pop( *this );
00763     vector< Individual * > indvec;
00764 
00765     //
00766     // clear number of copies
00767     //
00768     parents.selectInit( );
00769 
00770     //
00771     // copy individuals, discard old ones, save young ones
00772     //
00773     for( i = j = 0; i < size( ) && j < pop.size( ); ++j ) {
00774         //
00775         // if individual is a youngster copy it directly to next generation
00776         //
00777         if( pop[ j ].age < adolescence ) {
00778             pop[ j ].numCopies++;
00779             ( *this )[ i++ ] = pop[ j ];
00780         //
00781         // otherwise check whether individual exceeds its lifespan
00782         //
00783         } else if( pop[ j ].age < lifespan )
00784             indvec.push_back( &pop[ j ] );
00785     }
00786 
00787     //
00788     // same procedure for the parent population
00789     //
00790     for( j = 0; i < size( ) && j < parents.size( ); ++j ) {
00791         if( parents[ j ].age < adolescence ) {
00792             parents[ j ].numCopies++;
00793             ( *this )[ i++ ] = parents[ j ];
00794         } else if( parents[ j ].age < lifespan )
00795             indvec.push_back( &parents[ j ] );
00796     }
00797 
00798     //
00799     // sort remaining individuals
00800     //
00801     sortIndividuals( indvec );
00802 
00803     //
00804     // copy the best individuals to the current population
00805     //
00806     for( j = 0; i < size( ) && j < indvec.size( ); ++j ) {
00807         indvec[ j ]->numCopies++;
00808         ( *this )[ i++ ] = *indvec[ j ];
00809     }
00810 
00811     //
00812     // fill remaining slots with old individuals
00813     //
00814     pop.sort( );
00815     for( j = 0; i < size( ) && j < pop.size( ); ++j ) {
00816         pop[ j ].numCopies++;
00817         ( *this )[ i++ ] = pop[ j ];
00818     }
00819 
00820     //
00821     // increment age of all individuals
00822     //
00823     incAge( );
00824 }

00827 //===========================================================================
00828 
00829 //
00830 // added by Stefan Wiegand at 20.11.2002
00831 //
00832 
00833 int Population::pvm_pkpop(){
00834   //cout << "\tPopulation_pk" << endl;
00835 
00836   unsigned i;
00837 
00838   unsigned *s = new unsigned;
00839   *s = this->size();
00840   pvm_pkuint(s,1,1);
00841   delete s; 
00842 
00843   for (i = 0; i < this->size(); i++)
00844     ((*this)[i]).pvm_pkind();
00845 
00846   unsigned *u = new unsigned[4];
00847   u[0] = index;
00848   u[1] = subPop;
00849   u[2] = ascending;
00850   u[3] = spinOnce;
00851   pvm_pkuint(u,4,1);
00852   delete[] u; 
00853 
00854   return 1;
00855 };
00856 
00857 int Population::pvm_upkpop(){
00858   // cout << "\tPopulation_upk" << endl;
00859 
00860   unsigned i;
00861 
00862   unsigned *s = new unsigned;
00863   pvm_upkuint(s,1,1);
00864   if(this->size()!=*s){
00865     std::cerr << "EALib/Population.cpp: the population which has called pvm_upkpop() is of unexpected size!" << std::endl;
00866     std::cerr << "Please initialize this population prototypically." << std::endl;
00867     exit(-1);
00868   }
00869   delete s; 
00870 
00871   for ( i = 0; i < this->size(); i++)
00872     ((*this)[i]).pvm_upkind();
00873   
00874   unsigned *u   = new unsigned[4];
00875   pvm_upkuint(u,4,1)     ;
00876   index     = u[0]       ;
00877   subPop    = (u[1] != 0);
00878   ascending = (u[2] != 0);
00879   spinOnce  = (u[3] != 0);
00880   delete[] u; 
00881 
00882   return 1;
00883 };

00887 //===========================================================================
00888 //
00889 // linear dynamic scaling
00890 //
00891 //
00892 void Population::linearDynamicScaling( vector< double >& window,
00893                                        unsigned long t )
00894 {
00895     unsigned omega;
00896     double   f;
00897 
00898     omega = window.size( );
00899 
00900     if( t == 0 ) {  // fill scaling window
00901         f = worst( ).fitness;
00902         for( unsigned i = omega; i--; window[ i ] = f );
00903     } else {
00904         f = window[ ( t + omega ) % omega ];
00905         window[ t % omega ] = worst( ).fitness;
00906     }
00907 
00908     if( ascending )
00909         for( unsigned i = size( ); i--; )
00910             ( *this )[ i ].scaledFitness = f - ( *this )[ i ].fitness;
00911     else
00912         for( unsigned i = size( ); i--; )
00913             ( *this )[ i ].scaledFitness = ( *this )[ i ].fitness - f;
00914 }
00915 
00916 //===========================================================================
00917 //
00918 // Standard: Proportionale Selektion, die Fitnesswerte muessen positiv sein
00919 // Elitist : Die no_elitists besten Individuen aus parents und der aktuellen
00920 //           Population werden uebernommen und der Rest stammt aus parents
00921 //
00922 // stochastic universal sampling according to Baker,87
00923 //
00924 void Population::selectProportional( Population& parents,
00925                                      unsigned numElitists )
00926 {
00927     unsigned i;
00928     double   s, t;
00929 
00930     //
00931     // clear number of copies and select elitists
00932     //
00933     parents.selectInit( );
00934     selectElitists( parents, numElitists );
00935 
00936     //
00937     // selection probabilities are proportional to the (scaled) fitness
00938     //
00939     for( t = 0., i = 0; i < parents.size( ); i++ )
00940         if( parents[ i ].scaledFitness < t )
00941             t = parents[ i ].scaledFitness;
00942     for( s = 0., i = 0; i < parents.size( ); i++ )
00943         s += ( parents[ i ].scaledFitness -= t );
00944     for( i = 0; i < parents.size( ); i++ )
00945         parents[ i ].selProb = parents[ i ].scaledFitness / s;
00946 
00947     //
00948     // select individuals by roulette wheel selection
00949     //
00950     selectRouletteWheel( parents, numElitists );
00951 }
00952 
00953 //===========================================================================
00954 //
00955 // Standard: Proportionale Selektion, die Fitnesswerte muessen positiv sein
00956 //
00957 // stochastic universal sampling according to Baker,87
00958 //
00959 Individual& Population::selectOneIndividual( )
00960 {
00961     unsigned i;
00962     double   p, r, s, t;
00963 
00964     //
00965     // selection probabilities are proportional to the (scaled) fitness
00966     //
00967     for( t = 0., i = 0; i < size( ); ++i )
00968         if( ( *this )[ i ].scaledFitness < t )
00969             t = ( *this )[ i ].scaledFitness;
00970     for( s = 0., i = 0; i < size( ); ++i )
00971         s += ( ( *this )[ i ].scaledFitness -= t );
00972     for( i = 0; i < size( ); i++ )
00973         ( *this )[ i ].selProb = ( *this )[ i ].scaledFitness / s;
00974 
00975     //
00976     // select individuals by roulette wheel selection
00977     // (full stochastic method)
00978     //
00979     r = Rng::uni( 0, 1 );
00980     s = 0.;
00981     for( i = 0; i < size( ) &&
00982          r > ( p = ( *this )[ i ].selProb ) + s;
00983          s += p, ++i );
00984     ( *this )[ i ].numCopies++;
00985     return ( *this )[ i ];
00986 }
00987 
00988 //===========================================================================
00989 //
00990 // stochastic universal sampling according to Baker,87
00991 //
00992 void Population::selectLinearRanking( Population& parents,
00993                                       double etaMax,
00994                                       unsigned numElitists )
00995 {
00996     if( size( ) == 0 || parents.size( ) == 0 )
00997         return;
00998     else if( parents.size( ) == 1 )
00999         //
01000         // if the parent population has only one individual it
01001         // receives selection probability 1
01002         //
01003         parents[ 0 ].selProb = 1;
01004     else {
01005         //
01006         // sort parents (only pointers)
01007         //
01008         vector< Individual * > indvec( parents );
01009         sortIndividuals( indvec );
01010 
01011         //
01012         // selection probabilities
01013         //
01014         double a = 2 * ( etaMax - 1 ) / ( indvec.size( ) - 1 );
01015         for( unsigned i = 0; i < indvec.size( ); i++ )
01016             indvec[ i ]->selProb = ( etaMax - a * i ) / indvec.size( );
01017     }
01018 
01019     //
01020     // clear number of copies and select elitists
01021     //
01022     parents.selectInit( );
01023     selectElitists( parents, numElitists );
01024 
01025     //
01026     // select individuals by roulette wheel selection
01027     //
01028     selectRouletteWheel( parents, numElitists );
01029 }
01030 
01031 //===========================================================================
01032 //
01033 // numberOfIndividuals == parents.numberOfIndividuals => random walk
01034 //
01035 //
01036 void Population::selectUniformRanking( Population& parents,
01037                                        unsigned numElitists )
01038 {
01039     //
01040     // selection probabilities
01041     //
01042     double p = 1. / parents.size( );
01043     for( unsigned i = parents.size( ); i--; )
01044         parents[ i ].selProb = p;
01045 
01046     //
01047     // clear number of copies and select elitists
01048     //
01049     parents.selectInit( );
01050     selectElitists( parents, numElitists );
01051 
01052     //
01053     // select individuals by roulette wheel selection
01054     //
01055     selectRouletteWheel( parents, numElitists );
01056 }
01057 
01058 //===========================================================================
01059 //
01060 // no ( real ) correction for elitists
01061 //
01062 void Population::selectTournament( Population& parents,
01063                                    unsigned q,
01064                                    unsigned numElitists )
01065 {
01066     unsigned i, j;
01067     Individual* ind;
01068 
01069     //
01070     // clear number of copies and select elitists
01071     //
01072     parents.selectInit( );
01073     selectElitists( parents, numElitists );
01074 
01075     //
01076     // clear number of copies once again
01077     //
01078     for( i = parents.size( ); i--; )
01079         parents[ i ].numCopies = 0;
01080 
01081     //
01082     // loop for all individuals to be replaced
01083     //
01084     for( i = numElitists; i < size( ); ) {
01085         //
01086         // first candidate for tournament
01087         //
01088         ind = &parents.random( );
01089 
01090         //
01091         // loop for tournament size - 1
01092         //
01093         for( j = 1; j < q; j++ )
01094             //
01095             // select competitor and save the winner
01096             //
01097             ind = &parents.best( *ind, parents.random( ) );
01098 
01099         //
01100         // copy winner of tournament to next generation
01101         // if an elitist is selected the first time then skip it
01102         //
01103         if( ! ind->elitist || ind->numCopies > 0 )
01104             ( *this )[ i++ ] = *ind;
01105         ind->numCopies++;
01106     }
01107 }
01108 
01109 //===========================================================================
01110 //
01111 // no ( real ) correction for elitists
01112 //
01113 void Population::selectLinearRankingWhitley( Population& parents,
01114                                              double a,
01115                                              unsigned numElitists )
01116 {
01117     unsigned i, j;
01118 
01119     //
01120     // clear number of copies and select elitists
01121     //
01122     parents.selectInit( );
01123     selectElitists( parents, numElitists );
01124 
01125     //
01126     // clear number of copies once again
01127     //
01128     for( i = parents.size( ); i--; )
01129         parents[ i ].numCopies = 0;
01130 
01131     //
01132     // sort parents (only pointers)
01133     //
01134     vector< Individual * > indvec( parents );
01135     sortIndividuals( indvec );
01136 
01137     double b = 2 * ( a - 1 );
01138     double c = a * a;
01139     double d = 2 * b;
01140 
01141     for( i = numElitists; i < size( ); ) {
01142         j = unsigned( indvec.size( ) * 
01143                       ( a - sqrt( c - Rng::uni( 0, d ) ) ) / b );
01144 
01145         //
01146         // if an elitist is selected the first time then skip it
01147         //
01148         if( ! indvec[ j ]->elitist || indvec[ j ]->numCopies > 0 )
01149             ( *this )[ i++ ] = *indvec[ j ];
01150         indvec[ j ]->numCopies++;
01151     }
01152 }
01153 
01154 //===========================================================================
01155 //
01156 // EP-style Tournament Selection according to D. B. Fogel
01157 //
01158 bool Population::greaterScoreAscending( Individual*const& i1, Individual*const& 
01159 i2 )
01160 {
01161   if( i1->scaledFitness > i2->scaledFitness ) return true;
01162   if( i1->scaledFitness < i2->scaledFitness ) return false;
01163   if( i1->fitness < i2->fitness ) return true;
01164   return false;
01165 }
01166 
01167 bool Population::greaterScoreDescending( Individual*const& i1, Individual*const& 
01168 i2 )
01169 {
01170   if( i1->scaledFitness > i2->scaledFitness ) return true;
01171   if( i1->scaledFitness < i2->scaledFitness ) return false;
01172   if( i1->fitness > i2->fitness ) return true;
01173   return false;
01174 }
01175 
01176 //  void Population::selectEPTournament( Population& parents,
01177 //                                       unsigned q )
01178 //  {
01179 //    unsigned opponent;
01180 
01181 //    Population pop( *this );
01182 //    pop.append( parents );
01183 
01184 //    // perform tournament
01185 //    for( unsigned i = 0; i < pop.size(); i++ ) {
01186 //      //cout << pop[ i ].scaledFitness << " " << pop[ i ].fitnessValue() << endl;
01187 //      pop[ i ].scaledFitness = 0;
01188 //      for( unsigned j = 0; j < q; j++ ) {
01189 //        opponent = Rng::discrete( 0, pop.size( ) - 1 );
01190 //        if( ascending ) {
01191 //          if( pop[ i ].fitnessValue( ) <= pop[ opponent ].fitnessValue( ) ) 
01192 //            pop[ i ].scaledFitness++;
01193 //        } else {
01194 //          if( pop[ i ].fitnessValue( ) >= pop[ opponent ].fitnessValue( ) ) 
01195 //            pop[ i ].scaledFitness++;
01196 //        }
01197 //      }
01198 //    }
01199 
01200 //    // sort parents and offspring
01201 //    vector< Individual * > indvec( pop );
01202 //    std::sort( indvec.begin( ), indvec.end( ), 
01203 //               ascending
01204 //             ? Population::greaterScoreAscending
01205 //             : Population::greaterScoreDescending );
01206 //    for( unsigned j = 0; j < size(); j++ ) 
01207 //      ( *this )[ j ] = *indvec[ j ];
01208 //    /*
01209 //    for( unsigned j = 0; j < pop.size( ); j++ ) 
01210 //      cout << indvec[ j ]->fitnessValue( ) << " " << indvec[ j ]->scaledFitness << endl;
01211 //    */
01212 //  }
01213 
01214 void Population::selectEPTournament( Population& offspring,
01215                                      unsigned q )
01216 {
01217   Population pop( *this );
01218 
01219   unsigned i;
01220   unsigned opponent;
01221 
01222   unsigned poolSize = this->size() + offspring.size();
01223 
01224   vector< Individual * > indvec( poolSize );
01225 
01226     for(i = 0; i < this->size(); i++ ) indvec[i] = &(pop[ i ]);
01227   for(i = 0; i < offspring.size(); i++ ) indvec[this->size() + i] = &(offspring[ i ]);
01228 
01229   // perform tournament
01230   for(i = 0; i < poolSize; i++ ) {
01231     indvec[ i ]->scaledFitness = 0;
01232     for( unsigned j = 0; j < q; j++ ) {
01233       opponent = Rng::discrete( 0, poolSize - 1 );
01234       if( ascending ) {
01235         if( indvec[i]->fitnessValue( ) <= indvec[ opponent ]->fitnessValue( ) ) 
01236           indvec[ i ]->scaledFitness++;
01237       } else {
01238         if( indvec[ i ]->fitnessValue( ) >= indvec[ opponent ]->fitnessValue( ) ) 
01239           indvec[ i ]->scaledFitness++;
01240       }
01241     }
01242   }
01243 
01244   // sort parents and offspring
01245   std::sort( indvec.begin( ), indvec.end( ), 
01246              ascending
01247                ? Population::greaterScoreAscending
01248                : Population::greaterScoreDescending );
01249 
01250   for( unsigned j = 0; j < size(); j++ ) 
01251     ( *this )[ j ] = *indvec[ j ];
01252 }

01271     index.permute( );
01272 
01273     for( unsigned i = min( numElements, pop.numElements ); i--; )
01274         *elements[ index[ i ] ] = best( *elements[ index[ i ] ],
01275                                         *pop.elements[ i ] );
01276 }
01277 */

01279 //===========================================================================
01280 
01281 double Population::minFitness( ) const
01282 {
01283     double f = 0;
01284 
01285     if( size( ) ) {
01286         f = ( *this )[ 0 ].fitness;
01287         for( unsigned i = 1; i < size( ); i++ )
01288             f = min( f, ( *this )[ i ].fitness );
01289     }
01290 
01291     return f;
01292 }
01293 
01294 //===========================================================================
01295 
01296 double Population::maxFitness( ) const
01297 {
01298     double f = 0;
01299 
01300     if( size( ) ) {
01301         f = ( *this )[ 0 ].fitness;
01302         for( unsigned i = 1; i < size( ); i++ )
01303             f = max( f, ( *this )[ i ].fitness );
01304     }
01305 
01306     return f;
01307 }
01308 
01309 //===========================================================================
01310 
01311 double Population::meanFitness( ) const
01312 {
01313     double f = 0;
01314 
01315     if( size( ) ) {
01316         for( unsigned i = size( ); i--; )
01317             f += ( *this )[ i ].fitness;
01318         f /= size( );
01319     }
01320 
01321     return f;
01322 }
01323 
01324 //===========================================================================
01325 
01326 double Population::stdDevFitness( ) const
01327 {
01328     double m = 0;
01329     double s = 0;
01330 
01331     if( size( ) ) {
01332         for( unsigned i = size( ); i--; ) {
01333             m += ( *this )[ i ].fitness;
01334             s += ( *this )[ i ].fitness * ( *this )[ i ].fitness;
01335         }
01336         m /= size( );
01337         s /= size( );
01338         s -= m * m;
01339     }
01340 
01341     //
01342     // due to rounding problems the value of 's' may be negative
01343     // in this case 's' is supposed to be zero
01344     //
01345     return s > 0 ? sqrt( s ) : 0;
01346 }

01350 void Population::setAge( unsigned a )
01351 {
01352     for( unsigned i = size( ); i--; )
01353         ( *this )[ i ].setAge( a );
01354 }
01355 
01356 void Population::incAge( )
01357 {
01358     for( unsigned i = size( ); i--; )
01359         ( *this )[ i ].incAge( );
01360 }

01362 //===========================================================================
01363 
01364 bool Population::operator == ( const Population& pop ) const
01365 {
01366     if( size( ) == pop.size( ) ) {
01367         for( unsigned i = 0; i < size( ); ++i )
01368             if( ( *this )[ i ] != pop[ i ] ) return false;
01369 
01370         return index     == pop.index     &&
01371                subPop    == pop.subPop    &&
01372                ascending == pop.ascending &&
01373                spinOnce  == pop.spinOnce;
01374     }
01375 
01376     return false;
01377 }
01378 
01379 bool Population::operator < ( const Population& pop ) const
01380 {
01381     if( size( ) == pop.size( ) ) {
01382         bool less = false;
01383 
01384         for( unsigned i = 0; i < size( ); ++i )
01385             if( pop[ i ] < ( *this )[ i ] )
01386                 return false;
01387             else if( ! less && ( *this )[ i ] < pop[ i ] )
01388                 less = true;
01389 
01390         return less/*                     &&
01391                index     <= pop.index     &&
01392                subPop    <= pop.subPop    &&
01393                ascending <= pop.ascending &&
01394                spinOnce  <= pop.spinOnce*/;
01395     }
01396 
01397     return size( ) < pop.size( );
01398 }
